chefRecipes.cookingMethod: To make Morog Polao, you first need to marinate the chicken in a mixture of yogurt and spices for at least 2 hours or overnight. Then, you need to sauté the spices and add the marinated chicken to the pot and cook for 10-15 minutes. Next, you add the soaked rice to the pot and mix well with the chicken and spices. You pour enough water to cover the rice by about an inch and bring the water to a boil. Once the water is boiling, you reduce the heat to low and cover the pot with a tight-fitting lid. You cook the rice for about 20 minutes or until it's tender and the water has been absorbed. Finally, you fry the onions, raisins, cashews, and almonds separately and use them to garnish the Morog Polao. This dish is perfect for special occasions and can be served with salad, raita, or any other side dish of your choice.

To make kacchi biriyani, you first need to marinate the meat in a mixture of yogurt, spices, and onions for a few hours. Then, you need to partially cook the rice and set it aside. In a pot, you add the marinated meat and spread it evenly on the bottom. Then, you add a layer of half-cooked rice on top of the meat and repeat the layering process until you run out of meat and rice. Finally, you pour milk mixed with saffron and drizzle rose water on top of the rice. The pot is covered with a tight-fitting lid and sealed with dough or aluminum foil before being baked in the oven for 1 to 1.5 hours. Once cooked, you let the biriyani rest for a few minutes and then gently mix the meat and rice together before serving.

Rice is cooled in air temperature for 3–4 hours. Then cool water is added in a way that about an inch of water rises above the rice. Rice is generally covered with a light piece of fabric. 12–24 hours later panta bhat is ready.

aboutChef: Haji Salam Miah is one the richest cooks in Bangladesh with three six-storey apartment buildings in Mohammadpur, four restaurants called Salam's Kitchen and a community centre named Victoria Community Centre in the upscale part of Dhanmondi in the city. Basmati kacchi is most  popularised in Bangladesh

chefRecipes.cookingMethod: This recipe features the popular Hilsa fish, which is marinated in turmeric powder and salt before being cooked in a mustard-based gravy. The mustard paste is made by soaking black and yellow mustard seeds in water and blending them with green chillies. The fish is fried in mustard oil and then simmered in the gravy until it is fully cooked. Sorshe Ilish is often served with steamed rice and some green chillies on the side, making it a delicious and satisfying meal. This dish is a true representation of the rich culinary heritage of Bengal and is enjoyed by people all over the world.

To make Rui Bhaja, first, clean and cut the Rohu fish into medium-sized pieces. Then, marinate the fish with turmeric powder, salt, and red chilli powder for 15-20 minutes.Next, heat oil in a pan and fry the marinated fish pieces until they turn golden brown and crispy. Remove the fish from the pan and keep it aside. In the same pan, add thinly sliced onions, green chillies, and a pinch of salt. Fry until the onions turn translucent. Then, add chopped tomatoes, cumin powder, and coriander powder. Stir and cook until the tomatoes are soft and the spices are well mixed. Finally, add the fried fish pieces to the pan and mix them well with the spices. Cook for a few more minutes until the fish is fully coated with the spice mix.

To prepare shing mscher jhol, first, heat some oil in a pan and add a pinch of cumin seeds. Once the cumin seeds start crackling, add chopped onions and fry until they turn translucent. Next, add some grated ginger and minced garlic, and fry for a few seconds until fragrant. Then, add a couple of chopped tomatoes, along with some turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Fry the mixture for a few minutes until the tomatoes have cooked down and the mixture has thickened. At this point, add some water and bring the mixture to a boil. Then, add pieces of fish (typically a type of carp called shingi or shing) and let them cook in the sauce for a few minutes until they are fully cooked. Finally, add some freshly squeezed lemon juice and chopped coriander leaves, and give the mixture a final stir. The shing mscher jhol is now ready to be served with steamed rice or roti.

To make Shutki Bhuna, first, soak the dried fish in water for a few hours until it becomes soft. Drain the water and rinse the fish thoroughly.  Next, heat oil in a pan and fry the fish pieces until they turn golden brown. Remove the fish from the pan and keep it aside. In the same pan, add sliced onions, green chillies, and a pinch of salt. Fry until the onions turn translucent. Then, add chopped tomatoes, cumin powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chilli powder, and a pinch of sugar. Stir and cook until the tomatoes are soft and the spices are well mixed. Add the fried fish pieces to the pan and mix them well with the spices. Cook for a few more minutes until the fish is fully coated with the spice mix. Finally, add a cup of water to the pan and let the gravy come to a boil. Reduce the heat and let the dish simmer for 10-15 minutes until the fish is fully cooked and the gravy has thickened.

aboutChef: Behind the plate, Chef Nayeem is breaking down barriers. On the plate, he’s showcasing the incredible diversity the world has to offer. So, in honour of Chef Nayeem’s initiative, I challenge you to sit down at the dinner table tonight and try food from another culture. Expose yourself to a new part of the world, and immerse yourself in an unexplored culture that will make you say WOW.

aboutChef: Chef Muhammad Salah Uddin immigrated to the United States from Bangladesh in 1986. In 1986, he found himself helping his uncle run his restaurant business. He learned how to cook South Asian food on the job. For three years in the early nineties, he worked at East India Grill on Beverly and LaBrea.

aboutChef: Mr. Tony Khan hails from Khulna, he started his career in Singapore some 37 years ago and graduated from Sydney, Australia and further studied in Melbourne and Miami, USA.Known for his eclectic style of cuisine he is awarded as a “Top 10 Chef in the world 1998”, in Melbourne and “Chef of the year 1991” in the Pacific, PNG.Mr. Khan has traveled and prepared food at five-star hotels and cruise.

aboutChef: Miah was born in a village in South Sylhet Mahakuma, Chittagong Division, East Pakistan (now Bangladesh). He arrived at the age of 10 to Birmingham, England, with limited knowledge of English. He became interested in food and cooking due to which he began by working in the catering industry. He began by starting his own small takeout restaurant at the age of 17. Throughout the years working with hard work and determination, led to success in his business

aboutChef: Haji Fakruddin moved to Bangladesh in 1966 as he was facing severe financial issues. So he decided to work for his financial stability and started to learn cooking from Muslim Miah, who was the chief chef of Indian Nawabs. Working dedicatedly, he achieved mastery in the cooking field and became familiar with Mughal cuisine.
